## Quarto SEMANA10

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
#CARGANDO LA DATA A TRABAJAR 
data <- read_csv("C:/Users/USER/Downloads/cirrosis.csv")
```

You can add options to executable code like this

```{r}
#LIMPIAR LA DATA DE UNA COLUMNA ESPECIFICA, QUE CONTENGA DATOS 
data_limpia <-data[!is.na(data$Edad), ]
```

```{r}
#INSTALAR PAQUETES

install.packages("ggplot2")
library(ggplot2)

```

```{r}
#histograma
hist(data$Edad,
     main = "Histograma de Edad",
     xlab = "Edad",
     col = "lightblue",
     border = "black")

hist(data$Bilirrubina,
     main = "Histograma de Bilirrubina",
     xlab = "Bilirrubina",
     col = "lightgreen",
     border = "black")
```

```{r}
#MEDIDAS DE TENDENCIA CENTRAL
#MEDIA ARITMETICA
mean(data$Edad)
```

```{r}
#MODA
mode_Sexo<-names(sort(table(data$Sexo),decreasing = TRUE))
mode_Edad<-names(sort(table(data$Edad),decreasing = TRUE))

```

```{r}
#MEDIANA
median(data$Edad)
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).
